pageContext.description: Five specimen in very good condition: Edge sharp, but this looks as though it is due to modern grinding; there is a very strong marked midrib running down centre of blade on each side, and the edges of the blade are raised up in the form of flanges.
pageContext.patina: Dark brown patina; traces of golden bronze near cutting edge; a rust-colour on the side round the loops.
pageContext.collection: Burton on Trent, Nat. Hist. and Arch. Soc., The Museum, Burton on Trent
pageContext.site: England, staffordshire,burton on trent,found during excavations at horninglow, 14' below the surface, 'about 10 years ago' i.c. about 1927
